alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 6:22AM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Verde River...including Clarkdale...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM MST Wednesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.9 feet late tonight and then fall to 3.4 feet by Sunday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 6.5 Wed 5 am MST 10.4 7.2 4.3 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued this evening by 630 PM MST.
